intro: Ribes texense, commonly known as Texas gooseberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the genus Ribes in the family Grossulariaceae, which includes other species of gooseberries and currants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish-green berries that are typically harvested in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have serrated edges, while its stems are woody and covered in fine hairs. Ribes texense is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
